title: TRON: Ares Director Says ARES Just Wants To Be A Real Boy
description: TRON: Ares director Joachim R√∏nning explains that ARES, played by Jared Leto, is "a bit like Pinocchio" and wants to be a real boy.
author: Kaitlyn Booth
excerpt: Disney has been keeping their cards regarding TRON: Ares pretty close to their chest until recently. We saw some footage at D23 and learned that Nine Inch Nails would be doing the soundtrack, but that footage was never released to the public. We saw an extended trailer at the CinemaCon presentation and finally started to get [‚Ä¶]
text: Posted in: Disney, Movies | Tagged: Tron: AresTRON: Ares director Joachim R√∏nning explains that ARES, played by Jared Leto, is "a bit like Pinocchio" and wants to be a real boy.Article Summary TRON: Ares explores ARES, played by Jared Leto, desiring to become human, likened to Pinocchio. Director Joachim R√∏nning describes ARES as a program experiencing the world like an infant. Film examines the theme of humanity through an AI's eyes as it crosses into the real world. New trailer offers first detailed look at the film's plot and its intriguing exploration of AI. Disney has been keeping their cards regarding¬†TRON: Ares pretty close to their chest until recently. We saw some footage at D23 and learned that Nine Inch Nails would be doing the soundtrack, but that footage was never released to the public. We saw an extended trailer at the CinemaCon presentation and finally started to get some plot details. Now, we have a publicly released trailer, and people are starting to talk about what we can expect from this film. The details are still a bit vague, but director Joachim R√∏nning spoke to Empire about the character that Jared Leto is playing, and apparently, ARES just wants to be a real boy. "Not to be too clich√©d, but I always thought about him a bit like Pinocchio," R√∏nning said. "Ares wants to be a real boy. ‚Ä¶ We talked a lot about him almost being an infant, discovering the world for the first time, and how we wanted the audience to see the world through his eyes. The little things that we take for granted or don't see anymore. That was important. And then a bigger theme for the film is what it takes ‚Äî what it means ‚Äî to be human. Especially in this case, because he's a computer program." It's not¬†surprising to hear that¬†TRON: Ares will use the idea of a computer program to explore what it means to be human. We've been doing that for as long as the concept of robots has existed, and as AI becomes more prevalent, we'll see it explored in media in many different ways. So, while the idea isn't that original, the execution is where this film could really shine. TRON: Ares: Summary, Cast List, Release Date TRON: Ares¬†follows a highly sophisticated Program, Ares, who is sent from the digital world into the real world on a dangerous mission, marking humankind's first encounter with A.I. beings. The feature film is directed by Joachim R√∏nning and stars Jared Leto, Greta Lee, Evan Peters, Hasan Minhaj, Jodie Turner-Smith, Arturo Castro, Cameron Monaghan, with Gillian Anderson, and Jeff Bridges. Sean Bailey, Jeffrey Silver, Justin Springer, Jared Leto, Emma Ludbrook and Steven Lisberger are the producers, with Russell Allen serving as executive producer. Disney's TRON: Ares¬†releases in U.S. theaters on October 10, 2025. Enjoyed this? Please share on social media! Stay up-to-date and support the site by following Bleeding Cool on Google News today! html:
Posted in: Disney, Movies | Tagged: Tron: Ares

TRON: Ares director Joachim R√∏nning explains that ARES, played by Jared Leto, is "a bit like Pinocchio" and wants to be a real boy.

Article Summary

  • TRON: Ares explores ARES, played by Jared Leto, desiring to become human, likened to Pinocchio.
  • Director Joachim R√∏nning describes ARES as a program experiencing the world like an infant.
  • Film examines the theme of humanity through an AI's eyes as it crosses into the real world.
  • New trailer offers first detailed look at the film's plot and its intriguing exploration of AI.

Disney has been keeping their cards regarding¬†TRON: Ares pretty close to their chest until recently. We saw some footage at D23 and learned that Nine Inch Nails would be doing the soundtrack, but that footage was never released to the public. We saw an extended trailer at the CinemaCon presentation and finally started to get some plot details. Now, we have a publicly released trailer, and people are starting to talk about what we can expect from this film. The details are still a bit vague, but director Joachim R√∏nning spoke to Empire about the character that Jared Leto is playing, and apparently, ARES just wants to be a real boy.

"Not to be too clich√©d, but I always thought about him a bit like Pinocchio," R√∏nning said. "Ares wants to be a real boy. ‚Ä¶ We talked a lot about him almost being an infant, discovering the world for the first time, and how we wanted the audience to see the world through his eyes. The little things that we take for granted or don't see anymore. That was important. And then a bigger theme for the film is what it takes ‚Äî what it means ‚Äî to be human. Especially in this case, because he's a computer program."

It's not¬†surprising to hear that¬†TRON: Ares will use the idea of a computer program to explore what it means to be human. We've been doing that for as long as the concept of robots has existed, and as AI becomes more prevalent, we'll see it explored in media in many different ways. So, while the idea isn't that original, the execution is where this film could really shine.

TRON: Ares: Summary, Cast List, Release Date

TRON: Ares¬†follows a highly sophisticated Program, Ares, who is sent from the digital world into the real world on a dangerous mission, marking humankind's first encounter with A.I. beings.

The feature film is directed by Joachim R√∏nning and stars Jared Leto, Greta Lee, Evan Peters, Hasan Minhaj, Jodie Turner-Smith, Arturo Castro, Cameron Monaghan, with Gillian Anderson, and Jeff Bridges.

Sean Bailey, Jeffrey Silver, Justin Springer, Jared Leto, Emma Ludbrook and Steven Lisberger are the producers, with Russell Allen serving as executive producer.

Disney's TRON: Ares¬†releases in U.S. theaters on October 10, 2025.

Kaitlyn is the Editor-in-Chief at Bleeding Cool. Film critic and pop culture writer since 2013. Ace. Leftist. Nerd. Feminist. Writer. Replicant Translator. Cinephillic Virtue Signaler. She/Her. UFCA/GALECA Member. üçÖ Approved. Follow her Threads, Instagram, and Twitter @katiesmovies.
